description: From Old English mǣgbōt (“compensation paid to the kinsman of a murdered man”), mæg +‎ bot; Compare manbote.

entries.meaning: Compensation for the injury done by slaying a kinsman.
examples: Magbote or Mægbote, a Recompence anciently made in Money for the killing of one's Kinsman. — Phillips's New World of Words (ed. 6), 1706
